alert.note: Alert for Adams; Asotin; Chelan; Douglas; Ferry; Garfield; Grant; Lincoln; Okanogan; Pend Oreille; Spokane; Stevens; Whitman (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 20 at 11:27AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: An Air Quality Alert has been issued by the following agencies: Washington Department of Ecology in Spokane Colville Confederated Tribes Kalispel Indian Community Spokane Regional Clean Air Agency Spokane Tribe * WHAT: Air Quality Advisory because of degraded air quality. * WHERE: Adams, Asotin, Chelan, Douglas, Ferry, Garfield, Lincoln, Okanogan, Pend Oreille, Spokane, Stevens and Whitman counties. * WHEN: Until 10:00 AM PDT Monday August 21, 2023. * IMPACTS: At 11 AM PDT Sunday, several air quality sensors across central and eastern Washington varied from unhealthy to hazardous readings. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONSâ€¦ Air pollutants can cause breathing difficulties for children, the elderly, as well as persons with respiratory problems. Those individuals who are sensitive to increased particulate matter or smoke are encouraged to avoid prolonged or strenuous outdoor activity during this advisory. Open burning is prohibited by air quality rule. It is also recommended that all other individuals limit prolonged or strenuous activity outdoors. When Air Quality is hazardous, everyone should avoid all physical activity outdoors. Burning restrictions are in effect.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Asotin; Chelan; Douglas; Ferry; Garfield; Grant; Lincoln; Okanogan; Pend Oreille; Spokane; Stevens; Whitman
